article.headline: Central Michigan 84, Western Michigan 74
article.story: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. (AP) -- Kevin Nelson scored 23 points, including a career-high seven 3-pointers, to lead Central Michigan past Western Michigan 84-74 on Tuesday night. Western Michigan (16-9, 9-6 Mid-American) held a 37-36 halftime lead, but the Chippewas (8-15, 3-12) got out of the gates early in the second. Central Michigan went on a 10-2 run for a 51-43 lead and never trailed afterward. The Chippewas, who ended an eight-game skid, shot nearly 61 percent in the second half and 56.6 percent for the game. Sefton Barrett added 20 points and four rebounds, while Giordan Watson scored 12 points. The Broncos struggled from the field, shooting 36.2 percent for the game. Levi Rost led Western Michigan with 17 points and nine rebounds, while Joe Reitz scored 16, Brian Snider chipped in 15 and Ben Reed scored 10. Western Michigan has lost six of its last nine games.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
